meanings.definition: Distribute or spread over a wide area
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to disperse the seeds in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The wind helped disperse the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent3: Trying to disperse glitter can be a messy task.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to disperse the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display will disperse colors in the night sky.

meanings.definition: Scatter or separate in different directions
meanings.sent1: The children were told to disperse after playing in the park.
meanings.sent2: The protesters began to disperse as the sun set.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to disperse the audience with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent4: The clouds started to disperse, revealing a clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers will disperse throughout the room.

meanings.sent1: The magician's trick was to disperse the coin into thin air.
meanings.sent2: The morning mist slowly dispersed as the sun rose.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to disperse the mystery of the missing keys.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight began to disperse the shadows in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a brush to disperse the paint on the canvas.
